content: this legal document discusses a mutual rights arrangement between mr and mrs they have agreed to proceed with a mutual consent divorce and have provided information about their personal details marriage and children they have agreed on the division of property including clothing household items and financial accounts they have also addressed the allocation of a car and life insurance policies the parties have disclosed their debts and agreed on the responsibility for repayment lease agreements and insurance premiums have been discussed the communal real estate property will be allocated to mrs and she will assume the mortgage loan inheritance rights and marital benefits in the event of death have been excluded the parties have agreed to the dissolution of their matrimonial authority and have waived any compensation claims they have also addressed the impact of the arrangement on inheritance law and survivorship rights the text also explains the progress of a custody and property management case involving the couples children the parents have agreed to joint custody and made arrangements for the childrens residence education health and other aspects of their lives they have also agreed on the management of the childrens property the text discusses the contribution of each parent towards the costs of raising the children it mentions the possibility of wage authorization for child support payments the text further explains a legal case involving a parentcreditor and a government agency responsible for recovering child support payments the parentcreditor can request the agency to recover the costs of child support and may receive advances for these payments the text also mentions a clause regarding maintenance allowance where the parties agree not to owe maintenance to each other the costs fees and penalties related to the case will be divided equally between the parties the consequences of the divorce decree will affect third parties once it is recorded in the marriage and divorce certificates the parties must inform the notary of any suspensive conditions and grant a power of attorney to certain notaries for tax declarations the fee for the issuance of the deed is one hundred euros
